definition: inescapable net (idiom)/trap/dragnet
day/sky/heaven
gauze/to collect/to gather/to catch/to sift
surname Luo
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
net/network
World Wide Web (WWW)/lit. ten-thousand dimensional net covering heaven and earth/term coined by China News Digest and abbreviated to 萬維網|万维网[Wan4 wei2 wang3]
pinyin: Wan4 wei2 Tian1 luo2 Di4 wang3

sentences.english: That country is encircling India from all directions and slowly will start taking bites.
sentences.chinese: 中国在印度周围布下天罗地网，慢慢地要下嘴咬了。

sentences.english: His breathing is like a tight dragnet and covers with her whole individual.
sentences.chinese: 他的气息，就像一张天罗地网，将她整个人笼罩住。

sentences.english: If your ambush is properly set, the enemy won't walk into it.
sentences.chinese: 假如你已经布下天罗地网，敌军就不会走进圈套。

sentences.english: It's either that or cloud computing is forming a blanket over us, becoming the universal norm, not the exception.
sentences.chinese: 云计算成了天罗地网，成了普世准则，毫无例外。

definition: to arrange/to lay out
lit. even given wings, you couldn't fly (idiom); fig. impossible to escape
net/fishing net/bird net
lit. like a turtle in a jar/to be trapped (idiom)
cage used to hold or transport prisoners
to walk right into the trap
to catch a turtle in a jar (idiom); to set oneself an easy target/a turkey shoot
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
maze
silk screen/screen (printing)
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
battle array/disposition of forces/situation/circumstance
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
(fig.) specter
filling the entire sky/covering everything (of fog, crime, disaster etc)
to fish by casting a net/to capture/to surround and seize
